Collection.name: Records
Collection.type: Eamon.ThirdParty.BTree`1[[Eamon.Framework.IEffect, Eamon, Version=1.7.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]], Eamon, Version=1.7.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sign says, in block letters, "CONGRATULATIONS, YOU ARE AN EXPERIENCED AND ALERT ADVENTURER. YOU SHOULD DO VERY WELL."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The note is written in neat handwriting with a black pen. It says:

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: WELCOME TO THE EAMON DELUXE 5.0 DEMO ADVENTURE!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Demo Adventure attempts to show off every basic feature of the Eamon Deluxe 5.0 system. It has a large amount of embedded artifacts, at least one of every type of artifact, and a small assortment of monsters of both weak and strong varieties.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You will be roaming through a small and simple map with no odd connections or teleportation. The quest is simply to investigate the screams for help which brought you here while defeating enemies and taking as much loot as you can carry along the way.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Because this adventure was also written to test Eamon Deluxe during development stages and upgrades, no modifications were made to the standard adventure program nor was any special programming added.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: All of the events that happen in this demo are generated by routines already written into the standard adventure program. Anyone who would like to write their own adventure can easily do so using the options available on the Adventure Design Menu.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: I hope you enjoy this simple lighthearted demo and the Eamon Deluxe 5.0 gaming system as well. You will now be returned to your regularly scheduled adventure (already in progress).

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Frank Black**010

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: January, 1997**011

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Honolulu, Hawaii

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It seems to be the diary of a man who made a career out of buying stolen items and reselling them on the black market for a large profit. Most of it is a bit dull, but the last entry may clear up a few things.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It says, "I knew I shouldn't have done it! I'm a fool! Mr. X has discovered that I have been selling magic weapons which were stolen from his private collection. He said I must return them immediately or he will send his ogres and giants to kill me!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "But his reputation is well known, I am certain he will kill me whether I return them or not. I have no choice but to clear out my secret storage rooms and hide out in Interzone until things..."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: And with that the entry stops. It seems whoever was writing the entry never got a chance to finish it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Congratulations, you have found the secret message for this adventure! Give yourself a big pat on the back.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Congratulations, good and kind adventurer: You have freed the kidnapped owner of the house above these caverns. Even though he is a petty crook and a fence for stolen treasure, is still a good gesture on your part!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Congratulations, you have just discovered artifact type #12: A disguised monster! Note that the mimic also has a Combat Code of 1 so its battle verb will always be "attacks" instead of the standard battle verbs which don't apply to it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: (The next effect is intentionally blank, its purpose being to generate a test error in the Eamon Deluxe Demo Adventure)

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: (Eamon CS prevents the error condition using validation during data input.)

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: entire Clonatorium during his scandalous career. He swears that is all behind him now and he wants to join the Guild Protection Program. (Demo note: Combat code of -2: He will never fight in a battle.)

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: be eaten by a grue for sure!" As you come to your senses, you recognize him as Charles, a cheap scam artist who is always trying to get people to pay his tab at the Main Hall by claiming he is Donald Brown's cousin.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Nonetheless it still had some legible words for you to READ.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It is postmarked "Rick's Cafe, Interzone" and reads:*025

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: To: Red Fingers*026

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: From: Benway Rx*027

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Quite innarested in taking your money (and your other kidney) at the next annual Underground Poker Tournament. Also, an associate of mine is willing to pay for any swords named "Eccentric" you come across. Contact me for details.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The story is: You were wandering through the woods when you heard somebody cry out. You head in the direction which the sounds came from and come upon a small house in the middle of the woods. Standing outside is another member of the Free **029

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Adventurer's Guild who also heard the cry. Not being weak on courage, you decide to explore the house.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Eamon CS Note: Eddie will not use the wrench because his natural weapons are more lethal.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: LARGE OVEN.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: See EAMON CS 1.7 NEW COMMANDS for additional details.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: floor and you can GET ALL.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: to remove from or add to the container.
